== Main Inclusion Report for plasma-widget-facebook ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/plasma-widget-facebook]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** We want it on the Kubuntu CD for Social from the Start
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=facebook+plasmoid|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=facebook+plasmoid|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: ...
** Nothing running as root, no daemons
** Network activity: connects to a web page
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** Source code review performed by JonathanRiddell
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out the box
** No debconf questions
** Not in Debian
** <nowiki>[[http://kde-look.org/content/show.php/Facebook?content=106752|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm
** No upstream bug tracker
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** No test suite
0. ''UI standards:''
** No user visible strings
** End-user applications ships a desktop file
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance 
** Packaging system is cdbs
0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt, plasma, all in main
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Minimal maintenance needed
** Jonathan is responsible for quality and bug contact
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it Facebook Plasmoid
